page.title: 05BUILDINGS:BLEASBY/THURGARTON
page.content: The buildings,on the whole, pleasingly compliment the attractive setting.The main feature of{housing}is its{variety}:materials, styles,roofs,sizes and positions.{ {Trees}soften not only individual outlines but blend all together. The oldest building, {The Old House} ,was built in{Bleasby}about 1500 and is one of the few local examples of a {hall house}.The remaining houses,built over the last 250 years,range from the white,pebble dashed roadside cottages with small,high windows to ultra-modern,stone faced bungalows.{ What little{industrial building}there is is fairly attractive or well hidden or unobtrusive. All that remains of the huge{Norman {Priory at Thurgarton}- one tower and part of the nave - makes a fascinating and active church in a superb setting.
